Ameline Nussbaumer

Instructional Designer and eLearning Producer

CV

A little bit about me

A few highlights of my learning journey in the Learning and Development field so far: collaborating with great teams to provide high quality trainings to colleagues and local authorities around the world, working with experts in diverse fields and making complicated things simple and accessible, and liaising with professional elearning producers to develop content. The field of eLearning brings together two of my favorite things: creating something visually simple and beautiful, and helping people in a practical way through training.


Having worked in international organisations HQ for 5 years, I decided to go small and local this year, which is why I am currently serving a conservation NGO I love in Kenya. I'm having fun creating engaging designs to promote the great work they do and raising funds to protect threatened habitats and species.


What inspires me? Helping people & planet, working in collaborative, multi-cultural teams, creating beautiful designs, meeting new people, learning languages and fun facts.


Outside of work, you'll find me swimming in the nearest body of water, getting lost in nature with my birder-husband, or cooking/talking about food with friends.

Experience

International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)

Techno-Pedagogical Engineer July 2016 - December 2019

As Techno-Pedagogical Engineer, I managed learning initiatives liaising with internal experts and external providers. As Applications Trainer, I produced online learning courses, conducted trainings of trainers to build internal training capacity, and supported the digital transformation of the division.

  • Managed the design and development of trainings in various formats: eLearning, blended, mobile app, face-to-face
  • Produced user-friendly learning resources to facilitate colleagues' adoption and use of new digital tools
  • Delivered training of trainers and regular internal workshops on training practices and digital tools
instructional design eLearning training design eLearning production digital resources

United Nations Institute for Training and Research (UNITAR)

eLearning Consultant September 2014 - June 2016

As eLearning officer, I gained broad experience in the development, promotion and evaluation of online training courses, as well as key skills in project management and communication.

  • Facilitated, translated, and evaluated eLearning courses on Moodle
  • Conducted widespread promotion of eLearning courses on sustainable development
  • Co-organized an international Forum on Public-Private Partnerships (logistics and content)
eLearning facilitation Moodle project management training evaluation communication

Projects

Professional Standards for Protection Workers

Resilience in Economic Security

Managing Online Communities at the ICRC

Water and Habitat Data Training

Economic Security Reporting Tools

Results-Based Management in a Nutshell

ICRC Water and Habitat Community of Practice

HR Basics Learner Journal

NGO Communications and Fundraising

Education

University of Oxford

Comparative and International Education (MSc) October 2013 - September 2014
